I honestly love this game!! really fun and overall great game.

The balance is okay, the game feels very good from both sides. The matchmaking is absolutely and utterly awful and the worst I've seen in a video game. You can be rank 17 and get matched with rank 4's. Besides the matchmaking and the slight balance issues, the game is a really good game for the price and takes no DLC to be fun. All the killers feel quite enjoyable, while the perks feel powerful enough to not be considered overpowered from both sides. Overall, its a solid 8/10. Fun, but I can't complain enough about the matchmaking.

Dead by Daylight is it's own experience. It's an asymmetrical game where 4 survivors are pitted against a killer within a trial. The survivors' goal is pretty self explanatory... they have to survive. To do this they must repair 5 generators while also avoiding the killer. Once the generators are completely repaired, 2 exit gates are powered and can be opened to access the exit on the other side. The killer's objective on the other hand, is to sacrifice the survivors on the Entity's sacrificial hooks, which are scattered across the map. To do this, the killer must track down survivors and apply pressure to the generators so progress can be stalled. 

Overall, the game has a simple concept but it's very far from simple. Perks can be used by survivors and the killer to aid them during the trial and each player can equip up to 4 perks. Survivors can also bring items such as flashlights, toolboxes, med-kits, etc., these all have different uses. Items can also be equipped with 2 add-ons to further increase their usefulness. Killers on the other hand have a unique power to help them during the trial. Here are a few examples: Trapper can place bear traps across the map, Nemesis can use his Tentacle Strike to apply pressure to the survivors with the infection debuff it gives them while also making chases end faster, Spirit can phase shift around the map and appear out of nowhere to catch survivors off guard, etc. Killers can also equip add-ons to make their power stronger or in some cases, change their power's functionality. 

As for the gameplay, survivors are placed in a 3rd person perspective while the killer is in a first person perspective. The survivors are faced with skill checks while repairing generators but, during chases, mind-games are what really make the game interesting. Both the killer and survivors use mind-games whether it be to close distance between the killer and their prey or to completely end a chase by confusing the killer in making them think you're still at the area they spotted you in. Both sides offer a variety of ways to play which keeps gameplay refreshing. 

Now for my personal opinion on Dead by Daylight. The game is very good overall but, like every other title, it has it's flaws. The community is pretty mixed, some people are friendly, some are toxic, some play more casually, some in a more competitive fashion. I have around 212 hours on PC upon writing this and I have around the same amount of time on console aswell. I absolutely love this game, despite its flaws. It can feel grindy at times when you're saving up Iridescent Shards to purchase, in my case, a new non-licensed killer but to balance this, I play as a survivor instead of a killer, or vice-versa. When playing as a survivor, playing with some friends really enhances the experience in a good way. Playing as a solo queue survivor can also be enjoyable but, when I'm alone, I prefer playing killer because I'm a killer main.

I highly recommend this game to anyone looking for a unique game. It's price is also very fair and it comes on sale pretty often. 

Anyways, this was my review and breakdown of Dead by Daylight. I hope you found this helpful in making a decision on whether or not to buy the game. 

Post Scriptum: This game also offers pretty decent DLCs and and some very unique cosmetic items for each character.

Nothing beats twirling in circles around a pair of trees while screaming on your headset about whether or not Ghostface has green eggs and ham. 
For real though, there's enough survivors and killers that the replay value of this game is super high, the atmosphere is pretty great, and its easy to jump in and build a decent understanding of how things work while still having a bit of a learning curve because of the perks.

Its dark night in a forest, there is only 43 seconds left in the match, your working on the last generator to open the exit gates. Your teammates are on the other side of the map waiting for you to finish, when all the sudden you hear a roar in the distance. You start panicking, fumbling your skill checks, when it happens... You see it before you hear it, a red glow sprinting 40 mph at you, club in hand. You don't have time to react. Your in the death screen. Your teammates yell at you in the after game lobby text chat, while the killer is already queued for another game. "Why did you not loop him!" they yell at you with questionable grammar. You get off for the night, telling yourself you'll queue killer next time, "I'l play The Oni!" you tell yourself. As you go to sleep you cry softly into your pillow as you realize you spent your anniversary iridescent shards on a Hillbilly skin. Great game! 7/10
